result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon Marquis McKinney

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Devon M. McKinney, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Devon Marquis McKinney appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski appeared by video for Devon Marquis McKinney.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 12CF3610. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputy A. Sullivan. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Information contains an error. Matter is set for arraignment.   Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Arraignment scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devon Marquis McKinney not in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Devon Marquis McKinney.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for initial appearance.  Initial appearance was previously held.  Preliminary hearing remains scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 8:30 am in Branch PE.

Defendant Devon Marquis McKinney not in court, in custody. Attorney Amanda Poznanski not in court. Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel does not appear. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Devon Marquis McKinney appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Devon Marquis McKinney.  Prosecuting attorney Grant Ian Huebner appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devon Marquis McKinney appeared via Zoom.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski appeared in Court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for initial appearance.  Defendant unable to appear in person due to quarantine.  State requests an adjournment to be held in person.  Court rescheduled hearing.  This matter will be held in person in room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Devon Marquis McKinney in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for an initial appearance.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial

Defendant Devon Marquis McKinney in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski, both appearing via Zoom.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:09 AM. Case in Court for an initial appearance. Defense requests an adjournment due to defendant testing positive for COVID. Court set matter as requested. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
